intro: Galium gerardi var. genuinum, commonly known as the slender bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It features opposite, slender, hairy stems that often lie prostrate on the ground. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are entire, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks.
